Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label at least one land habitat (like a playground, garden, forest, or parking lot) and one water habitat (like a pond, stream, or lake).
The student can include and clearly identify different living things (such as trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, clams) within each habitat drawn.
The student can show patterns in the drawing by comparing the types of living things found in each habitat.
The student can represent how each habitat is organized, showing where various plants and animals are located.
The student can make observations from media or firsthand investigations to inform their drawings and ensure accuracy.
